meanings.definition: To jump from an aircraft and perform a free fall before deploying a parachute.
meanings.sent1: She skydived for the first time and felt the rush of the wind.
meanings.sent2: They skydived together on a sunny afternoon for an adrenaline-filled experience.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to skydive off the couch, landing gracefully on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: His heart skydived into his stomach when he realized he forgot to pack his parachute.
meanings.sent5: The idea of skydiving made her palms sweaty and her heart race with excitement.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she skydived for the first time and loved the thrill.
meanings.sent2: He skydived multiple times before deciding it was his favorite hobby.
meanings.sent3: The cake had skydived off the table, creating a messy but funny situation.
meanings.sent4: His grades skydived after he stopped studying for exams.
meanings.sent5: The sun had already set when they skydived into the darkness, feeling like stars in the sky.
